hypothesis_content.title: Cross-Exchange Liquidity Arbitrage During Neutral Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with low volatility (BTC 20-day IV < 45%), persistent exchange-specific liquidity gaps (measured by order book depth disparity > 2.5%) predict mean-reverting price divergences with 85%+ accuracy within 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Arbitrage desks monitor liquidity metrics more closely than prices alone. Sustained depth disparities indicate temporary market maker withdrawal, creating exploitable but short-lived opportunities.
entry_conditions: Exchange A vs Exchange B order book depth disparity > 2.5% for > 2 hours
Price divergence between exchanges > 0.8% but < 2% (avoiding structural breaks)
No major exchange-specific news in past 24 hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price convergence to within 0.15% OR depth disparity < 0.5%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Divergence widens beyond 2.5% OR regime shifts to STRESS

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price divergences persist or widen despite liquidity gap closure
